docs.title: 🎬 Feature Request: Add Veo Video Generation Support (Similar to Image Generation)
📋 Summary
docs.text:
Add support for Google's Veo 3.1 video generation models to CLIProxyAPI, following the same architecture pattern as the existing gemini-3-pro-image-preview image generation support.

This would enable users to generate videos through CLIProxyAPI using the same client format with modalities: ["video", "text"] and video_config, just like how image generation currently works.

GitHub Issue: https://github.com/router-for-me/CLIProxyAPIPlus/issues/94

docs.title: 🎯 Current State (Image Generation)
docs.text:
Currently working perfectly: 

# image_gen.py - Image Generation (✅ Working)
POST http://127.0.0.1:8317/v1/chat/completions
Authorization: Bearer ccs-internal-managed

{
  "model": "gemini-3-pro-image-preview",
  "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "A cute cat"}],
  "modalities": ["image", "text"],
  "image_config": {
    "aspect_ratio": "1:1",
    "image_size": "1K"
  }
}

Response: 

{
  "choices": [{
    "message": {
      "images": [{
        "image_url": {"url": "data:image/png;base64,..."}
      }]
    }
  }]
}

docs.title: 💻 Reference Implementation (image_gen.py)
docs.text: CLIProxyAPI ใช้ format translation mechanism ของตัวเอง - ไม่ได้ผ่าน OpenRouter

docs.title: Key Code Sections
docs.text:
1. Authentication (lines 41-44) 

HEADERS = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer ccs-internal-managed",
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
}

2. Request Payload (lines 94-107) 

payload = {
    "model": model,
    "messages": [
        {
            "role": "user",
            "content": prompt
        }
    ],
    "modalities": ["image", "text"],
    "image_config": {
        "aspect_ratio": aspect_ratio,
        "image_size": image_size
    }
}

3. Response Handling (lines 129-189) 

result = response.json()

if result.get("choices"):
    message = result["choices"][0].get("message", {})

    if message.get("images"):
        for i, image_obj in enumerate(message["images"]):
            image_url = image_obj.get("image_url", {}).get("url", "")

            if image_url:
                # Save base64 image data
                saved_path = save_image(image_url, output_dir, i)

docs.title: 🎬 Requested Feature (Video Generation)
docs.text:
Desired behavior: 

# video_gen.py - Video Generation (🎯 Desired)
POST http://127.0.0.1:8317/v1/chat/completions
Authorization: Bearer ccs-internal-managed

{
  "model": "veo-3.1-generate-preview",
  "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "A cat playing with a ball"}],
  "modalities": ["video", "text"],
  "video_config": {
    "duration_seconds": "8",
    "aspect_ratio": "16:9",
    "resolution": "720p"
  }
}

Expected Response: 

{
  "choices": [{
    "message": {
      "videos": [{
        "video_url": {"url": "data:video/mp4;base64,..."}
      }]
    }
  }]
}

docs.title: Official REST API Format
docs.text:
Endpoint: 

POST https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/veo-3.1-generate-preview:predictLongRunning

Request Format (Google Native): 

{
  "instances": [{
    "prompt": "A cinematic shot of a majestic lion in the savannah"
  }],
  "parameters": {
    "aspectRatio": "16:9",
    "resolution": "720p",
    "durationSeconds": "8"
  }
}

Response (Async Operation): 

{
  "name": "operations/veo-3.1-generate-preview/123456789",
  "done": false,
  "metadata": {
    "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.api.Operation"
  }
}

Poll for Completion: 

GET https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/{operation_name}

Final Response: 

{
  "name": "operations/...",
  "done": true,
  "response": {
    "generateVideoResponse": {
      "generatedSamples": [{
        "video": {
          "uri": "https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/..."
        }
      }]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Supported Veo Models
docs.text: Model Type Resolution Duration veo-3.1-generate-preview Preview 720p, 1080p 4s, 6s, 8s veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview Fast Preview 720p, 1080p 4s, 6s, 8s veo-3.0-generate-001 Stable 720p, 1080p 8s veo-3.0-fast-generate-001 Fast Stable 720p, 1080p 8s

docs.title: Key Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Values Description prompt string - Text description for video aspectRatio string "16:9", "9:16" Video aspect ratio resolution string "720p", "1080p" Video resolution durationSeconds string "4", "6", "8" Video length in seconds negativePrompt string - What NOT to include

docs.title: 1. Client Format (Input) - CLIProxyAPI Format
docs.text:
Video Generation Request: 

{
  "model": "veo-3.1-generate-preview",
  "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "Prompt text here"}],
  "modalities": ["video", "text"],
  "video_config": {
    "duration_seconds": "8",
    "aspect_ratio": "16:9",
    "resolution": "720p",
    "negative_prompt": "cartoon, drawing, low quality"
  }
}

docs.title: 2. Translation Logic (Go)
docs.text:
CLIProxyAPI Format → Google Veo Format: 

func translateVideoRequest(req CLIProxyAPIRequest) VeoRequest {
    config := req.VideoConfig

    return VeoRequest{
        Instances: []VeoInstance{
            {Prompt: extractPrompt(req.Messages)},
        },
        Parameters: VeoParameters{
            AspectRatio: translateAspectRatio(config.AspectRatio),
            Resolution: config.Resolution,
            DurationSeconds: config.DurationSeconds,
            NegativePrompt: config.NegativePrompt,
        },
    }
}

docs.title: 3. Response Translation
docs.text:
Google Veo → CLIProxyAPI Format: 

func translateVideoResponse(resp VeoResponse) CLIProxyAPIResponse {
    video := resp.Response.GenerateVideoResponse.GeneratedSamples[0].Video

    return CLIProxyAPIResponse{
        Choices: []Choice{
            {
                Message: Message{
                    Videos: []Video{
                        {
                            VideoURL: VideoURL{
                                URL: "data:video/mp4;base64," + video.VideoBytes,
                            },
                        },
                    },
                },
            },
        },
    }
}

docs.title: 4. Async Operation Handling
docs.text:
Video generation is asynchronous - needs polling:

func waitForVideoOperation(operationName string) (*VeoResponse, error) {
    for {
        resp := getOperation(operationName)

        if resp.Done {
            return resp.Response, nil
        }

        time.Sleep(10 * time.Second)
    }
}

docs.title: 5. Model Routing
docs.text:
Add to routing table: 

var modelRoutes = map[string]string{
    // Image models (existing)
    "gemini-3-pro-image-preview": "imagen-3.0-generate-001",

    // Video models (new)
    "veo-3.1-generate-preview": "veo-3.1-generate-preview:predictLongRunning",
    "veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview": "veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview:predictLongRunning",
    "veo-3.0-generate-001": "veo-3.0-generate-001:predictLongRunning",
    "veo-3.0-fast-generate-001": "veo-3.0-fast-generate-001:predictLongRunning",
}

docs.title: Image Generation (Current)
docs.text:
Client Request (CLIProxyAPI format)
    ↓
CLIProxyAPI Translator
    ↓
Query CCS for OAuth token
    ↓
Google Imagen API (synchronous)
    ↓
CLIProxyAPI Translator
    ↓
Client Response (CLIProxyAPI format)

docs.title: Video Generation (Proposed)
docs.text:
Client Request (CLIProxyAPI format)
    ↓
CLIProxyAPI Translator
    ↓
Query CCS for OAuth token
    ↓
Google Veo API (asynchronous)
    ↓
CLIProxyAPI Poller (poll until done)
    ↓
CLIProxyAPI Translator
    ↓
Client Response (CLIProxyAPI format)

docs.title: 🔧 Key Differences from Image Generation
docs.text: Aspect Image Generation Video Generation Response Type Synchronous Asynchronous (Long-running operation) Processing Time ~5-30 seconds 1-5 minutes Polling Required No Yes Response Format Direct base64 URI + async polling Output Size ~100KB-2MB ~5-20MB Endpoint :predict :predictLongRunning

docs.title: Must Have
docs.text:
• Support veo-3.1-generate-preview model
  • Accept CLIProxyAPI format with modalities: ["video", "text"]
  • Accept video_config parameters:
  • duration_seconds
  • aspect_ratio
  • resolution
  • negative_prompt
  • Translate CLIProxyAPI → Google Veo format
  • Handle async operation (polling mechanism)
  • Translate response back to CLIProxyAPI format
  • Return video as base64 data URI (data:video/mp4;base64,...)
  • Use OAuth authentication from CCS (same as image)
  • Route through gemini provider channel

docs.title: Nice to Have
docs.text:
• Support veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview (faster generation)
  • Support veo-3.0-generate-001 (stable version)
  • Support image-to-video generation
  • Support video extension
  • Progress reporting during polling

docs.title: Related Discussion
docs.text:
Discussion #378: Image gen not supported/enabled for gemini-3-pro-image-preview?

This discussion contains working code examples for image generation via CLIProxyAPI, which served as the reference implementation for this video generation feature request.

docs.title: Reference Implementation
docs.text:
File: image_gen.py

Key Sections: - Lines 41-44: CCS OAuth authentication headers - Lines 94-107: Request payload structure - Lines 129-189: Response parsing and image extraction

docs.title: Google Official Documentation
docs.text:
• Video API Docs: https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/video
  • REST API: POST /v1beta/models/veo-3.1-generate-preview:predictLongRunning
  • Async Operations: Poll GET /v1beta/{operation_name} until done: true

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Video generation should use the same OAuth authentication as image generation: - Token source: ~/.ccs/cliproxy/auth/gemini-*.json - Header: Authorization: Bearer ccs-internal-managed - Provider: gemini channel

docs.title: Compatibility
docs.text:
• Backward compatible: Does not break existing image generation
  • Same endpoint: /v1/chat/completions
  • Same auth method: ccs-internal-managed
  • New modality: video (in addition to existing image, text)

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
• Handle operation timeout
  • Handle quota exceeded
  • Handle polling failures
  • Handle video generation failures

docs.title: 🙏 Thank You
docs.text:

Labels: enhancement, video generation, veo, feature request Priority: Medium Complexity: Medium (requires async polling, similar architecture to existing image generation) Status: Open - https://github.com/router-for-me/CLIProxyAPIPlus/issues/94

docs.title: Video Extension
docs.text: Extend existing videos with AI-generated content.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Video extension allows you to continue an existing video with new AI-generated content. The AI analyzes the last frames and generates continuation based on your prompt.

docs.title: Critical Requirements
docs.text: Requirement Details Frame Rate Source video MUST be 24fps Model Must use veo-2.0 or veo-2.0-exp Source Local file or GCS URI (NOT external URLs)

docs.title: Why 24fps?
docs.text: The Veo API only accepts 24fps videos for extension. Videos with different frame rates will fail with "fps mismatch" error.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Extend a local video
python video_gen.py "The cat runs faster" \
  --extend-video previous_video.mp4 \
  --model veo-2.0

# Extend with GCS storage
python video_gen.py "Continue the scene" \
  --extend-video previous_video.mp4 \
  --storage-uri gs://my-bucket/videos \
  --model veo-2.0

docs.title: Local File
docs.text:
python video_gen.py "Continue scene" \
  --extend-video /path/to/video.mp4

The script will:

  1. Check if video is 24fps
  2. Upload to GCS if --storage-uri provided
  3. Use base64 encoding if no GCS

docs.title: GCS URI
docs.text:
python video_gen.py "Continue scene" \
  --extend-video gs://my-bucket/videos/source.mp4

Direct GCS URI is faster - no upload needed.

docs.title: With Reference Images
docs.text:
Combine extension with reference images:

python video_gen.py "The person continues walking" \
  --extend-video previous.mp4 \
  --reference-image avatar.png:asset \
  --model veo-2.0

docs.title: With Last Frame
docs.text:
Specify where the video should end:

python video_gen.py "Transform to sunset" \
  --extend-video daytime.mp4 \
  --last-frame sunset.jpg \
  --model veo-2.0

docs.title: Workflow: Creating Long Videos
docs.text:
Chain multiple extensions to create longer videos:

# Step 1: Generate initial video
python video_gen.py "A person walking" --preset quality
# Output: video_001.mp4

# Step 2: Extend first video
python video_gen.py "The person starts running" \
  --extend-video video_001.mp4 --model veo-2.0
# Output: video_002.mp4

# Step 3: Extend again
python video_gen.py "The person jumps over obstacle" \
  --extend-video video_002.mp4 --model veo-2.0
# Output: video_003.mp4

# Combine with ffmpeg
ffmpeg -i "concat:video_001.mp4|video_002.mp4|video_003.mp4" -c copy final.mp4

docs.title: "fps mismatch"
docs.text:
Problem: Source video is not 24fps

Solution: Convert to 24fps using ffmpeg:

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -r 24 -c:v libx264 output_24fps.mp4

docs.title: "video is empty"
docs.text:
Problem: External URL used (not supported)

Solution: Download video first, then use local file:

# Download video
curl -o local_video.mp4 "https://example.com/video.mp4"

# Convert to 24fps if needed
ffmpeg -i local_video.mp4 -r 24 local_24fps.mp4

# Use local file
python video_gen.py "Continue" --extend-video local_24fps.mp4

docs.title: "Model does not support video_extension"
docs.text:
Problem: Using veo-3.1 models

Solution: Use veo-2.0:

python video_gen.py "Continue" \
  --extend-video input.mp4 \
  --model veo-2.0

docs.title: Auto-Upload Feature
docs.text:
When --storage-uri is provided, local files are automatically uploaded:

python video_gen.py "Continue scene" \
  --extend-video local_video.mp4 \
  --storage-uri gs://my-bucket/uploads

Flow: 

Local file → Upload to GCS → Use gcsUri in API → Generate → Download

docs.title: Do
docs.text:
• Use Veo-generated videos (always 24fps)
  • Use --storage-uri for reliable uploads
  • Use --model veo-2.0 for extension
  • Keep prompts consistent with source video

docs.title: Don't
docs.text:
• Use external URLs directly
  • Use veo-3.1 models for extension
  • Use videos with non-24fps frame rate
  • Create drastic scene changes

docs.title: Planned Features (v2.25)
docs.text:
Future version will support:

# Planned: Auto-download and convert external URLs
python video_gen.py "Continue" \
  --extend-video-from-url "https://example.com/video.mp4"

This will:

  1. Download video from URL
  2. Convert to 24fps using ffmpeg
  3. Upload to GCS
  4. Proceed with extension

docs.title: Learn More
docs.text:
• Generation Modes - All generation modes
  • Video Models - Model comparison
  • Reference Images - Using references with extension
  • GCS Storage - Setting up GCS

docs.title: Video Models
docs.text: Comparison of available Veo models.

docs.title: veo-3.1-generate-preview (Recommended)
docs.text:
Feature Value Audio Yes - generates with sound Quality Best - highest resolution Video Extension Not supported Cost $$$ Higher

Best for: Final production, videos with audio

python video_gen.py "A waterfall" --model veo-3.1-generate-preview

docs.title: veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview
docs.text:
Feature Value Audio Yes Quality Good - faster generation Video Extension Not supported Cost $$ Medium

Best for: Quick previews, drafts

python video_gen.py "A waterfall" --model veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview
# Or use preset
python video_gen.py "A waterfall" --preset quick

docs.title: veo-2.0
docs.text:
Feature Value Audio No Quality Good Video Extension Supported Cost $$ Medium

Best for: Video extension, chaining videos

python video_gen.py "A waterfall" --model veo-2.0
# Required for video extension
python video_gen.py "Continue scene" --extend-video input.mp4 --model veo-2.0

docs.title: veo-2.0-exp
docs.text:
Feature Value Audio No Quality Good Video Extension Supported Reference Style Supported Cost $$ Medium

Best for: Style transfer, experimental features

python video_gen.py "A cityscape" \
  --model veo-2.0-exp \
  --reference-image painting.jpg:style

docs.title: Feature Comparison Matrix
docs.text: Feature veo-3.1 veo-3.1-fast veo-2.0 veo-2.0-exp Audio Generation Video Extension Reference Style Reference Asset Insert/Remove Objects Generation Speed Medium Fast Medium Medium Quality Best Good Good Good

docs.title: Model Selection Guide
docs.text:
Need audio?
  → YES: veo-3.1-generate-preview
  → NO: Continue below

Need video extension?
  → YES: veo-2.0 or veo-2.0-exp
  → NO: Continue below

Need style transfer?
  → YES: veo-2.0-exp
  → NO: Continue below

Need fast preview?
  → YES: veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview
  → NO: veo-3.1-generate-preview

docs.title: Using Presets
docs.text:
Presets automatically select the best model:

Preset Model Duration Use Case quick veo-3.1-fast 5s Fast preview quality veo-3.1-generate 8s Production extend veo-2.0 8s Video extension budget veo-2.0 5s Cost saving 
python video_gen.py "A waterfall" --preset quality

docs.text: Model Gemini API Vertex AI veo-3.1-generate-preview veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview veo-2.0 veo-2.0-exp

  • Generation Modes - All generation modes
  • Presets - Using presets

docs.title: Video Generation Modes
docs.text: All 8 video generation modes explained with examples.

docs.title: Text-to-Video
docs.text:
Generate video from text prompt only.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "A cat walking in a garden"

Parameters:

  • prompt - Description of the video (required)
  • --duration - 5-8 seconds (default: 5)
  • --aspect-ratio - 16:9, 9:16, 1:1 (default: 16:9)

Best for: Simple scenes, abstract concepts, quick prototypes

docs.title: Image-to-Video
docs.text:
Animate a static image into video.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "The cat starts dancing" --image cat.jpg

Parameters:

  • prompt - Description of motion (required)
  • --image - First frame image (required)

Supported formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP

Best for: Animating photos, product demos, character animation

docs.title: First & Last Frames
docs.text:
Create video that interpolates between two images.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "Smooth transition" \
  --image start.jpg \
  --last-frame end.jpg

Parameters:

  • --image - First frame (required)
  • --last-frame - Last frame (required)

Best for: Morphing effects, transitions, storytelling

docs.title: Video Extension
docs.text:
Extend an existing video with new content.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "The cat runs faster" \
  --extend-video previous_video.mp4 \
  --model veo-2.0

Parameters:

  • --extend-video - Source video to extend (required)
  • --storage-uri - GCS bucket for upload (recommended)

Requirements

  • Source video MUST be 24fps
  • Use GCS URI or local file (external URLs not supported)
  • Use model with video_extension support (veo-2.0)

Best for: Creating longer videos, continuing scenes

See Video Extension for detailed guide.

docs.title: Reference Asset
docs.text:
Use up to 3 reference images to preserve subject identity.

Usage: 

# Single reference
python video_gen.py "A person waving" \
  --reference-image avatar.png:asset

# Multiple references (same subject, different angles)
python video_gen.py "A person waving" \
  --reference-image front.png:asset \
  --reference-image side.png:asset \
  --reference-image back.png:asset

Parameters:

  • --reference-image PATH:asset - Reference image with type
  • Maximum 3 asset images

Best for: Consistent character, product videos

See Reference Images for detailed guide.

docs.title: Reference Style
docs.text:
Apply visual style from a reference image.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "A cityscape" \
  --reference-image painting.jpg:style \
  --model veo-2.0-exp

Parameters:

  • --reference-image PATH:style - Style reference image
  • Maximum 1 style image
  • Only supported on veo-2.0-exp model

Best for: Style transfer, artistic effects

docs.title: Insert Objects
docs.text:
Add new objects to existing video using mask.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "Add a flying bird" \
  --video source.mp4 \
  --mask bird_area.png \
  --mask-mode insert

Parameters:

  • --video - Source video (required)
  • --mask - Mask image defining insert area (required)
  • --mask-mode insert - Set mode to insert (required)

Best for: Adding elements, VFX

docs.title: Remove Objects
docs.text:
Remove objects from existing video using mask.

Usage: 

python video_gen.py "Remove the watermark" \
  --video source.mp4 \
  --mask watermark_area.png \
  --mask-mode remove

Parameters:

  • --video - Source video (required)
  • --mask - Mask image defining remove area (required)
  • --mask-mode remove - Set mode to remove (required)

Best for: Removing unwanted elements, cleanup

docs.title: Mode Detection
docs.text:
The script automatically detects mode based on provided arguments:

Arguments Detected Mode prompt only text_to_video prompt + --image image_to_video prompt + --image + --last-frame first_and_last_frames prompt + --extend-video video_extension prompt + --reference-image:asset reference_asset prompt + --reference-image:style reference_style prompt + --video + --mask-mode insert insert_objects prompt + --video + --mask-mode remove remove_objects

docs.title: Model Compatibility
docs.text: Mode veo-3.1 veo-3.1-fast veo-2.0 veo-2.0-exp text_to_video image_to_video first_and_last video_extension reference_asset reference_style insert_objects remove_objects

docs.title: Video Generation Overview
docs.text: Generate AI videos using Google Veo models with 8 different generation modes.

docs.title: Supported Models
docs.text:
Model Audio Extension Quality Cost veo-3.1-generate-preview Yes No Best $$$ veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview Yes No Good $$ veo-2.0 No Yes Good $$ veo-2.0-exp No Yes Good $$

Recommended

Use veo-3.1-generate-preview for best quality with audio.

docs.title: Generation Modes
docs.text: Mode Description Required Inputs Text-to-Video Generate from text only Prompt Image-to-Video Animate from image Prompt + Image First & Last Frames Interpolate two images Prompt + 2 Images Video Extension Extend existing video Prompt + Video Reference Asset Preserve subject Prompt + 1-3 Images Reference Style Apply style Prompt + Style Image Insert Objects Add to video Prompt + Video + Mask Remove Objects Remove from video Prompt + Video + Mask

docs.title: Quick Examples
docs.text:
# Text-to-Video
python video_gen.py "A cat walking in a garden"

# Image-to-Video
python video_gen.py "The cat starts running" --image cat.jpg

# Video Extension
python video_gen.py "Continue the scene" --extend-video previous.mp4

# Reference Asset (preserve subject)
python video_gen.py "A person dancing" --reference-image avatar.png:asset

docs.title: Output Specifications
docs.text: Setting Options Duration 5s, 6s, 7s, 8s (default: 5s) Aspect Ratio 16:9, 9:16, 1:1 Resolution 720p (16:9), 1280x720 Frame Rate 24 fps Format MP4

docs.title: API Method
docs.text:
Video generation uses predictLongRunning (asynchronous):

Request → Operation ID → Poll for completion → Download video

Typical generation time: 60-180 seconds

docs.title: Cost Overview
docs.text:
Model Per Video (5s) veo-3.1-generate-preview ~$0.50 veo-3.1-fast-generate-preview ~$0.25 veo-2.0 ~$0.20

Cost Estimation

Use --estimate-cost to preview cost before generating.

docs.title: Reference Images
docs.text: Guide to using reference images for subject preservation and style transfer.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Reference images help the AI understand what you want:

  • Reference Asset - Preserve subject identity (face, product, character)
  • Reference Style - Apply visual style (art style, color palette)

docs.title: Unified Format (v2.24)
docs.text:
Use --reference-image PATH:TYPE format:

# Asset type (default if not specified)
--reference-image avatar.png:asset

# Style type
--reference-image painting.jpg:style

# Without type (defaults to asset)
--reference-image avatar.png

docs.title: Reference Asset
docs.text: Preserve subject identity across the video.

docs.title: Single Reference
docs.text:
python video_gen.py "A person waving hello" \
  --reference-image avatar.png:asset

docs.title: Multiple References (Max 3)
docs.text:
Use multiple images of the same subject from different angles:

python video_gen.py "A person dancing" \
  --reference-image front.png:asset \
  --reference-image side.png:asset \
  --reference-image back.png:asset

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use clear, well-lit photos
  • Show the subject from different angles
  • Keep consistent lighting across references
  • Don't mix different subjects
  • Don't use blurry images

docs.title: Reference Style
docs.text:
Apply visual style from a reference image.

python video_gen.py "A cityscape at sunset" \
  --reference-image impressionist_painting.jpg:style \
  --model veo-2.0-exp

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Model Requirement

  • Only supported on veo-2.0-exp model
  • Maximum 1 style image per request
  • Cannot mix with asset references

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use distinctive art styles
  • Choose high-quality style references
  • Match style to content theme
  • Don't use photos as style (use asset instead)

docs.title: Cannot Mix Types
docs.text:
The API does not support mixing asset and style in the same request:

# ❌ This will fail
python video_gen.py "A person" \
  --reference-image avatar.png:asset \
  --reference-image painting.jpg:style

# Error: "does not support this mix"

docs.title: Solution: Use One Type
docs.text:
# ✅ Assets only
python video_gen.py "A person dancing" \
  --reference-image front.png:asset \
  --reference-image side.png:asset

# ✅ Style only
python video_gen.py "A landscape" \
  --reference-image watercolor.jpg:style

docs.title: Limits Summary
docs.text: Type Maximum Model Support Asset 3 images All Veo models Style 1 image veo-2.0-exp only Mixed  Not allowed -

docs.title: With Video Extension
docs.text:
You can combine reference images with video extension:

python video_gen.py "The person continues walking" \
  --extend-video previous.mp4 \
  --reference-image avatar.png:asset \
  --model veo-2.0

docs.title: Legacy Parameters (Deprecated)
docs.text:
The following are deprecated but still work:

# Deprecated - still works
--reference-asset avatar.png
--reference-style painting.jpg

# Recommended - use instead
--reference-image avatar.png:asset
--reference-image painting.jpg:style

docs.title: "Reference type not supported"
docs.text:
• Check model compatibility
  • Style only works with veo-2.0-exp

docs.title: "Too many references"
docs.text:
• Maximum 3 asset images
  • Maximum 1 style image

docs.title: "Mixed types not supported"
docs.text:
• Use only asset OR only style in one request
  • Cannot combine both
